fieldsOfStudy: Logistics, Trade, and Transportation / Graduate Certificate in Economic Development

educations.schoolName: Escola Americana do Rio de Janeiro

headline: Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP) Field Representative at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary: Reliable, dedicated, and dependable customer-focused professional experienced in the areas of governmental compliance, strategic planning, recruitment and retention, program development and implementation, resource management, and revenue assurance. Recognized by supervisors, colleagues, customers, and stakeholders for high level of professionalism with a proven ability to effectively build rapport, establish trust, and deliver results. Bilingual (English & Portuguese) and cross-culturally experienced by having the opportunity to live, study, and work in multiple countries.

defaultPosition.title: Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP) Field Representative

positions.title: Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP) Field Representative

positions.description:
- Accurately compiled, analyzed, generated, and delivered weekly internal reports on financial and statistical metrics as it related to the production, shipment, delivery, and installation of wireless communication devices surpassing $20 million in quarterly sales.  

- Provided manufacture, field operations, and project management support by proactively tracking, organizing, maintaining, and monitoring compliance and execution of all contracts, requisitions, inbound requests, purchase orders, production schedules, order fulfillment statuses, shipment/distribution outcomes, and reverse logistics results.

- Promoted information visibility by closely measuring, managing, and delivering monthly forecasts and accurate results on multiple stock keeping units (SKUs).  

- Implemented effective accounts receivable initiatives which enhanced fulfillment and accuracy on revenue recognition matters while simultaneously reducing past due payments from 10 to 05 business days.   

- Instrumental in conducting internal audits, analysis, and reconciliation of revenue streams in yearly excess of $85 million.
positions.title: Manager - Operations & Logistics

positions.description:
- Instructed undergraduate students in the field of business administration, in the subject area of personal finance. 

- Researched, designed, and implemented lesson plans and instructional resources that motivated student learning. 

- Provided quality instruction while meeting course requirements, objectives, and student learning outcomes.
positions.title: Adjunct Instructor - Business Administration

positions.description:
- Served as key liaison among international students, faculty, and staff by providing technical guidance on matters related to the F-1/F-2 nonimmigrant classification and/or U.S. permanent residency status.

- Primarily responsible for monitoring and ensuring that all rules and regulations, as established and governed by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), were complied with at all times.  

- Served as the Designated School Official (DSO) for all matters related to the Student and Exchange Visitor Information System (SEVIS). 

- Proven experience and expertise in collecting, reviewing, processing, completing, maintaining, and managing all nonimmigrant files for over 100 international students, representing 33 nations from around the globe. 

- Planned, developed, marketed, and executed innovative recruitment, enrollment, and retention strategies, quadrupling the universityâs overall international student enrollment within five academic years. 

- Conceptualized the creation, development, and implementation of new and updated web/print promotional materials including brochures, application packets, and procedural handbooks to be used as marketing/recruitment tools for prospective international students and their families.

- Established contacts and educational partnerships with internationally recognized high schools, colleges/universities, recruitment agencies, and professional associations covering a span of 12 countries from across the globe. 

- Initiated and conducted personal visits to international recruitment events in Brazil, China, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Nepal, and Nicaragua. 

- Authored and coordinated an elaborate program proposal and educational curriculum which led to the Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP) approval of the universityâs first English language training program â English Language Center.
positions.title: Director of International Admissions - Immigration Specialist
